001package com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.oklab;
002
003import com.badlogic.gdx.Application.ApplicationType;
004import com.badlogic.gdx.Gdx;
005import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.*;
006import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Mesh.VertexDataType;
007import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.VertexAttributes.Usage;
008import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch;
009import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch;
010import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion;
011import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.ShaderProgram;
012import com.badlogic.gdx.math.Affine2;
013import com.badlogic.gdx.math.MathUtils;
014import com.badlogic.gdx.math.Matrix4;
015import com.badlogic.gdx.utils.BufferUtils;
016
017import java.nio.Buffer;
018import java.nio.IntBuffer;
019import java.util.Arrays;
020
021/**
022 * Draws batched quads using indices. Like {@link ColorfulBatch}, this adds another attribute to store an
023 * extra color's worth of channels, but also has optimizations when rendering from multiple Textures. This
024 * maintains an LFU texture-cache to combine draw calls with different textures effectively.
025 * <br>
026 * Use this Batch if you frequently utilize more than a single texture between calling {@link #begin()} and
027 * {@link #end()}. An example would be if your Atlas is spread over multiple Textures or if you draw with individual
028 * Textures. This version is compatible with OpenGL ES 2.0.
029 *
030 * @see Batch
031 * @see SpriteBatch
032 * @see ColorfulBatch
033 *
034 * @author mzechner (Original SpriteBatch)
035 * @author Nathan Sweet (Original SpriteBatch)
036 * @author VaTTeRGeR (TextureArray Extension)
037 */
038public class TextureArrayColorfulBatch extends ColorfulBatch {
039
040    public final int spriteVertexSize = 6; // Size of a ColorfulSprite in bytes
041    public final int spriteFloatSize = spriteVertexSize * 4 + 4; // How many bytes per ColorfulSprite here
042    /**
043     * The name of the attribute used for the tweak color in GLSL shaders.
044     */
045    public static final String TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE = "a_tweak";
046    public static final String TEXTURE_INDEX_ATTRIBUTE = "a_texture_index";
047
048    /**
049     * The maximum number of available texture units for the fragment shader.
050     * Set internally by {@link #getMaxTextureUnits()}.
051     */
052    protected static int maxTextureUnits = -1;
053
054    /**
055     * Textures in use (index: Texture Unit, value: Texture).
056     * This is managed internally, and should only be used by this class or carefully by subclasses.
057     */
058    protected final Texture[] usedTextures;
059
060    /**
061     * LFU Array (index: Texture Unit Index - value: Access frequency).
062     * This is managed internally, and should only be used by this class or carefully by subclasses.
063     */
064    protected final int[] usedTexturesLFU;
065
066    /**
067     * Gets sent to the fragment shader as a uniform "uniform sampler2d[X] u_textures" .
068     * This is managed internally, and should only be used by this class or carefully by subclasses.
069     */
070    protected final IntBuffer textureUnitIndicesBuffer;
071
072    /**
073     * Used to capture the log of any errors during shader compilation.
074     */
075    protected static String shaderErrorLog = null;
076
077    /**
078     * A constant packed float that can be assigned to this ColorfulBatch's tweak with {@link #setTweak(float)} to make
079     * all the tweak adjustments virtually imperceptible. When this is set as the tweak, it won't change the
080     * lightness multiplier or lightness contrast, and it won't change either chromatic value multiplier.
081     */
082    public static final float TWEAK_RESET = ColorTools.oklab(0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f);
083
084    /**
085     * The current number of textures in the LFU cache. Gets reset when calling {@link #begin()}
086     **/
087    protected int currentTextureLFUSize = 0;
088
089    /**
090     * The current number of texture swaps in the LFU cache. Gets reset when calling {@link #begin()}
091     **/
092    protected int currentTextureLFUSwaps = 0;
093
094    /**
095     * Constructs a new TextureArrayColorfulBatch with a size of 1000, one buffer, and the default shader.
096     *
097     * @see TextureArrayColorfulBatch#TextureArrayColorfulBatch(int, ShaderProgram)
098     */
099    public TextureArrayColorfulBatch() {
100        this(1000);
101    }
102
103    /**
104     * Constructs a TextureArrayColorfulBatch with one buffer and the default shader.
105     *
106     * @see TextureArrayColorfulBatch#TextureArrayColorfulBatch(int, ShaderProgram)
107     */
108    public TextureArrayColorfulBatch(int size) {
109        this(size, null);
110    }
111
112    /** Constructs a new TextureArrayColorfulBatch. Sets the projection matrix to an orthographic projection with y-axis point
113     * upwards, x-axis point to the right and the origin being in the bottom left corner of the screen. The projection will be
114     * pixel perfect with respect to the current screen resolution.
115     * <p>
116     * The defaultShader specifies the shader to use. Note that the names for uniforms for this default shader are different than
117     * the ones expect for shaders set with {@link #setShader(ShaderProgram)}.
118     * @param size The max number of sprites in a single batch. Max of 8191.
119     * @param defaultShader The default shader to use. This is not owned by the TextureArrayColorfulBatch and must be disposed
120     *           separately.
121     * @throws IllegalStateException Thrown if the device does not support texture arrays. Make sure to implement a Fallback to
122     *            {@link ColorfulBatch} in case Texture Arrays are not supported on a client's device.
123     * @see #createDefaultShader(int, String, String)
124     * @see #getMaxTextureUnits() */
125    public TextureArrayColorfulBatch(int size, ShaderProgram defaultShader) throws IllegalStateException {
126        // 32767 is max vertex index, so 32767 / 4 vertices per sprite = 8191 sprites max.
127        if (size > 8191) throw new IllegalArgumentException("Can't have more than 8191 sprites per batch: " + size);
128
129        getMaxTextureUnits();
130
131        if (maxTextureUnits == 0) {
132            throw new IllegalStateException(
133                    "Texture Arrays are not supported on this device:" + System.lineSeparator() + shaderErrorLog);
134        }
135
136        if (defaultShader == null) {
137            shader = createDefaultShader(maxTextureUnits);
138            ownsShader = true;
139
140        } else {
141            shader = defaultShader;
142            ownsShader = false;
143        }
144
145        usedTextures = new Texture[maxTextureUnits];
146        usedTexturesLFU = new int[maxTextureUnits];
147
148        // This contains the numbers 0 ... maxTextureUnits - 1. We send these to the shader as a uniform.
149        textureUnitIndicesBuffer = BufferUtils.newIntBuffer(maxTextureUnits);
150        for (int i = 0; i < maxTextureUnits; i++) {
151            textureUnitIndicesBuffer.put(i);
152        }
153        textureUnitIndicesBuffer.flip();
154
155        VertexDataType vertexDataType = (Gdx.gl30 != null) ? VertexDataType.VertexBufferObjectWithVAO : VertexDataType.VertexArray;
156
157        // The vertex data is extended with one float for the texture index and one float for the tweak.
158        mesh = new Mesh(vertexDataType, false, size * 4, size * 6,
159                new VertexAttribute(Usage.Position, 2, ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE),
160                new VertexAttribute(Usage.ColorPacked, 4, ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE),
161                new VertexAttribute(Usage.TextureCoordinates, 2, ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0"),
162                new VertexAttribute(VertexAttributes.Usage.ColorPacked, 4, TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE),
163                new VertexAttribute(Usage.Generic, 1, TEXTURE_INDEX_ATTRIBUTE));
164
165        projectionMatrix.setToOrtho2D(0, 0, Gdx.graphics.getWidth(), Gdx.graphics.getHeight());
166
167        vertices = new float[size * spriteFloatSize];
168
169        int len = size * 6;
170        short[] indices = new short[len];
171        short j = 0;
172        for (int i = 0; i < len; i += 6, j += 4) {
173            indices[i] = j;
174            indices[i + 1] = (short)(j + 1);
175            indices[i + 2] = (short)(j + 2);
176            indices[i + 3] = (short)(j + 2);
177            indices[i + 4] = (short)(j + 3);
178            indices[i + 5] = j;
179        }
180
181        mesh.setIndices(indices);
182    }
183
184    /**
185     * Returns a new instance of the default shader used by TextureArrayColorfulBatch for GL2 when no shader is
186     * specified. This overload always uses {@link #vertexShader} and {@link #fragmentShader} to make its ShaderProgram.
187     * This ignores {@link ShaderProgram#prependVertexCode} and {@link ShaderProgram#prependFragmentCode}. Instead, it
188     * sets the GLSL version of the shader code automatically to 100 or 150, as appropriate.
189     * @see #getMaxTextureUnits()
190     * @param maxTextureUnits look this up once with {@link #getMaxTextureUnits()} for the current hardware
191     * @return the default ShaderProgram for this Batch
192     */
193    public static ShaderProgram createDefaultShader (int maxTextureUnits){
194        return createDefaultShader(maxTextureUnits, vertexShader, fragmentShader);
195    }
196
197    /**
198     * Returns a new instance of the default shader used by TextureArrayColorfulBatch for GL2 when no shader is
199     * specified. Does not have any {@code #version} specified in the shader source.
200     * This expects an extra attribute (relative to a normal SpriteBatch) that is used
201     * for the tweak, and handles its own extra attribute internally for the current texture index.
202     * If the fragment shader contains the String <code>@maxTextureUnits@</code>, that will be replaced by the value of
203     * the parameter {@code maxTextureUnits}, and this should be done at runtime by this class.
204     * This ignores {@link ShaderProgram#prependVertexCode} and {@link ShaderProgram#prependFragmentCode}. Instead, it
205     * sets the GLSL version of the shader code automatically to 100 or 150, as appropriate.
206     * @see #getMaxTextureUnits()
207     * @param maxTextureUnits look this up once with {@link #getMaxTextureUnits()} for the current hardware
208     * @param vertex typically {@link #vertexShader}, but can also be {@link #vertexShaderOklabWithRGBATint} or user-defined
209     * @param fragment typically {@link #fragmentShader}, but can also be user-defined
210     * @return the default ShaderProgram for this Batch
211     */
212    public static ShaderProgram createDefaultShader (int maxTextureUnits, String vertex, String fragment) {
213        final ApplicationType appType = Gdx.app.getType();
214        String prependVertex = ShaderProgram.prependVertexCode;
215        String prependFragment = ShaderProgram.prependFragmentCode;
216        ShaderProgram.prependVertexCode = "";
217        ShaderProgram.prependFragmentCode = "";
218        String fragmentShader;
219        if (appType == ApplicationType.Android || appType == ApplicationType.iOS || appType == ApplicationType.WebGL) {
220            fragmentShader = "#version 100\n" + fragment.replace("@maxTextureUnits@", String.valueOf(maxTextureUnits));
221        } else {
222            fragmentShader = "#version 150\n" + fragment.replace("@maxTextureUnits@", String.valueOf(maxTextureUnits));
223        }
224
225        ShaderProgram shader = new ShaderProgram(vertex, fragmentShader);
226        ShaderProgram.prependVertexCode = prependVertex;
227        ShaderProgram.prependFragmentCode = prependFragment;
228
229        if (!shader.isCompiled()) {
230            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Error compiling shader: " + shader.getLog());
231        }
232
233        return shader;
234    }
235
236    /**
237     * The default shader's vertex part.
238     * <br>
239     * This is meant to be used with {@link #fragmentShader}.
240     */
241    public static final String vertexShader = "attribute vec4 " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
242            + "attribute vec4 " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
243            + "attribute vec2 " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
244            + "attribute float " + TEXTURE_INDEX_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
245            + "attribute vec4 " + TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
246            + "uniform mat4 u_projTrans;\n"
247            + "varying vec4 v_color;\n"
248            + "varying vec4 v_tweak;\n"
249            + "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n"
250            + "varying float v_texture_index;\n"
251            + "\n"
252            + "void main()\n"
253            + "{\n"
254            + "   v_color = " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
255            + "   v_color.a = v_color.a * (255.0/254.0);\n"
256            + "   v_tweak = " + TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
257            + "   v_texCoords = " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
258            + "   v_texture_index = " + TEXTURE_INDEX_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
259            + "   gl_Position =  u_projTrans * " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
260            + "}\n";
261
262    /**
263     * The default shader's fragment part.
264     * <br>
265     * This must have the String <code>@maxTextureUnits@</code> replaced with the value of {@link #maxTextureUnits} at
266     * runtime. This is done by {@link #createDefaultShader(int, String, String)}, but not if you create a
267     * {@link ShaderProgram} yourself.
268     * <br>
269     * This is meant to be used with {@link #vertexShader} or {@link #vertexShaderOklabWithRGBATint}
270     * and passed to {@link #TextureArrayColorfulBatch(int, ShaderProgram)}
271     */
272    public static final String fragmentShader = "#ifdef GL_ES\n"
273            + "#define LOWP lowp\n"
274            + "precision mediump float;\n"
275            + "#else\n"
276            + "#define LOWP\n"
277            + "#endif\n"
278            + "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n"
279            + "varying LOWP vec4 v_tweak;\n"
280            + "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n"
281            // Added for texture array support
282            + "varying float v_texture_index;\n"
283            + "uniform sampler2D u_textures[@maxTextureUnits@];\n"
284            // End
285            + "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n"
286            + "float toOklab(float L) {\n"
287            + "  return pow(L, 1.5);\n"
288            + "}\n"
289            + "float fromOklab(float L) {\n"
290            + "  return pow(L, 0.666666);\n"
291            + "}\n"
292            + "void main()\n"//
293            + "{\n"
294            // Changed for texture array support
295            + "  vec4 tgt = texture2D(u_textures[int(v_texture_index)], v_texCoords);\n"
296            // End
297            + "  vec3 lab = mat3(+0.2104542553, +1.9779984951, +0.0259040371, +0.7936177850, -2.4285922050, +0.7827717662, -0.0040720468, +0.4505937099, -0.8086757660) *"
298            + "             pow(mat3(0.4121656120, 0.2118591070, 0.0883097947, 0.5362752080, 0.6807189584, 0.2818474174, 0.0514575653, 0.1074065790, 0.6302613616) \n"
299            + "             * (tgt.rgb * tgt.rgb), forward);\n"
300            + "  lab.x = toOklab(lab.x);\n"
301            + "  // At this point, lab has the value of the RGBA pixel in the texture at v_texCoords, converted to Oklab color space.\n"
302            + "  // You can do the same for v_color and even v_tweak if they come in as RGBA values.\n"
303            + "  lab.x = (lab.x - 0.5) * 2.0;\n"
304            + "  float contrast = exp(v_tweak.w * (-2.0 * 255.0 / 254.0) + 1.0);\n"
305            + "  lab.x = pow(abs(lab.x), contrast) * sign(lab.x);\n"
306            + "  lab.x = fromOklab(clamp(lab.x * v_tweak.x + v_color.x, 0.0, 1.0));\n"
307            + "  lab.yz = clamp((lab.yz * v_tweak.yz + v_color.yz - 0.5) * 2.0, -1.0, 1.0);\n"
308            + "  lab = mat3(1.0, 1.0, 1.0, +0.3963377774, -0.1055613458, -0.0894841775, +0.2158037573, -0.0638541728, -1.2914855480) * lab;\n"
309            + "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sqrt(clamp("
310            + "                 mat3(+4.0767245293, -1.2681437731, -0.0041119885, -3.3072168827, +2.6093323231, -0.7034763098, +0.2307590544, -0.3411344290, +1.7068625689) *\n"
311            + "                 (lab * lab * lab),"
312            + "                 0.0, 1.0)), v_color.a * tgt.a);\n"
313            + "}";
314
315    /**
316     * A special-purpose vertex shader meant for use only here in the Oklab ColorfulBatch, this can be used to create a
317     * ShaderProgram and passed into the constructor or {@link #setShader(ShaderProgram)}. Using this vertex shader lets
318     * you specify the batch color (or the tint) as a "normal" RGBA color, while using Oklab for the tweak. The fragment
319     * shader doesn't need to be modified here, so you can use {@link #fragmentShader} as normal.
320     */
321    public static final String vertexShaderOklabWithRGBATint =
322            "attribute vec4 a_position;\n"
323                    + "attribute vec4 a_color;\n"
324                    + "attribute vec2 a_texCoord0;\n"
325                    + "attribute float " + TEXTURE_INDEX_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
326                    + "attribute vec4 " + TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
327                    + "uniform mat4 u_projTrans;\n"
328                    + "varying vec4 v_color;\n"
329                    + "varying vec4 v_tweak;\n"
330                    + "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n"
331                    + "varying float v_texture_index;\n"
332                    + "\n"
333                    + "vec3 rgbToLab(vec3 start) {\n"
334                    + "  vec3 lab = mat3(+0.2104542553, +1.9779984951, +0.0259040371, +0.7936177850, -2.4285922050, +0.7827717662, -0.0040720468, +0.4505937099, -0.8086757660) *\n"
335                    + "             pow(mat3(0.4121656120, 0.2118591070, 0.0883097947, 0.5362752080, 0.6807189584, 0.2818474174, 0.0514575653, 0.1074065790, 0.6302613616) \n"
336                    + "             * (start.rgb * start.rgb), vec3(1.0/3.0));\n"
337                    + "  lab.x = pow(lab.x, 1.5);\n"
338                    + "  lab.yz = lab.yz * 0.5 + 0.5;\n"
339                    + "  return lab;\n"
340                    + "}\n"
341                    + "\n"
342                    + "void main()\n"
343                    + "{\n"
344                    + "  v_color = " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
345                    + "  v_color.w = v_color.w * (255.0/254.0);\n"
346                    + "  v_color.rgb = rgbToLab(v_color.rgb);\n"
347                    + "  v_tweak = " + TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
348                    + "  v_texCoords = " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
349                    + "   v_texture_index = " + TEXTURE_INDEX_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
350                    + "  gl_Position =  u_projTrans * " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
351                    + "}";
352
353    @Override
354    public void begin() {
355        if (drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("TextureArrayColorfulBatch.end must be called before begin.");
356
357        renderCalls = 0;
358
359        currentTextureLFUSize = 0;
360        currentTextureLFUSwaps = 0;
361
362        Arrays.fill(usedTextures, null);
363        Arrays.fill(usedTexturesLFU, 0);
364
365        Gdx.gl.glDepthMask(false);
366
367        if (customShader != null) {
368            customShader.begin();
369        } else {
370            shader.begin();
371        }
372
373        setupMatrices();
374
375        drawing = true;
376    }
377
378    @Override
379    public void end() {
380        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("TextureArrayColorfulBatch.begin must be called before end.");
381
382        if (idx > 0) flush();
383
384        drawing = false;
385
386        GL20 gl = Gdx.gl;
387
388        gl.glDepthMask(true);
389
390        if (isBlendingEnabled()) {
391            gl.glDisable(GL20.GL_BLEND);
392        }
393
394        if (customShader != null) {
395            customShader.end();
396        } else {
397            shader.end();
398        }
399    }
400
401    @Override
402    public void draw(Texture texture, float x, float y, float originX, float originY, float width, float height, float scaleX,
403                     float scaleY, float rotation, int srcX, int srcY, int srcWidth, int srcHeight, boolean flipX, boolean flipY) {
404        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("TextureArrayColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
405
406        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
407
408        flushIfFull();
409
410        final float ti = activateTexture(texture);
411
412        // bottom left and top right corner points relative to origin
413        final float worldOriginX = x + originX;
414        final float worldOriginY = y + originY;
415        float fx = -originX;
416        float fy = -originY;
417        float fx2 = width - originX;
418        float fy2 = height - originY;
419
420        // scale
421        if (scaleX != 1 || scaleY != 1) {
422            fx *= scaleX;
423            fy *= scaleY;
424            fx2 *= scaleX;
425            fy2 *= scaleY;
426        }
427
428        // construct corner points, start from top left and go counter clockwise
429        final float p1x = fx;
430        final float p1y = fy;
431        final float p2x = fx;
432        final float p2y = fy2;
433        final float p3x = fx2;
434        final float p3y = fy2;
435        final float p4x = fx2;
436        final float p4y = fy;
437
438        float x1;
439        float y1;
440        float x2;
441        float y2;
442        float x3;
443        float y3;
444        float x4;
445        float y4;
446
447        // rotate
448        if (rotation != 0) {
449            final float cos = MathUtils.cosDeg(rotation);
450            final float sin = MathUtils.sinDeg(rotation);
451
452            x1 = cos * p1x - sin * p1y;
453            y1 = sin * p1x + cos * p1y;
454
455            x2 = cos * p2x - sin * p2y;
456            y2 = sin * p2x + cos * p2y;
457
458            x3 = cos * p3x - sin * p3y;
459            y3 = sin * p3x + cos * p3y;
460
461            x4 = x1 + (x3 - x2);
462            y4 = y3 - (y2 - y1);
463        } else {
464            x1 = p1x;
465            y1 = p1y;
466
467            x2 = p2x;
468            y2 = p2y;
469
470            x3 = p3x;
471            y3 = p3y;
472
473            x4 = p4x;
474            y4 = p4y;
475        }
476
477        x1 += worldOriginX;
478        y1 += worldOriginY;
479        x2 += worldOriginX;
480        y2 += worldOriginY;
481        x3 += worldOriginX;
482        y3 += worldOriginY;
483        x4 += worldOriginX;
484        y4 += worldOriginY;
485
486        float u = srcX * invTexWidth;
487        float v = (srcY + srcHeight) * invTexHeight;
488        float u2 = (srcX + srcWidth) * invTexWidth;
489        float v2 = srcY * invTexHeight;
490
491        if (flipX) {
492            float tmp = u;
493            u = u2;
494            u2 = tmp;
495        }
496
497        if (flipY) {
498            float tmp = v;
499            v = v2;
500            v2 = tmp;
501        }
502
503        final float color = this.color, tweak = this.tweak;
504
505        vertices[idx++] = x1;
506        vertices[idx++] = y1;
507        vertices[idx++] = color;
508        vertices[idx++] = u;
509        vertices[idx++] = v;
510        vertices[idx++] = tweak;
511        vertices[idx++] = ti;
512
513        vertices[idx++] = x2;
514        vertices[idx++] = y2;
515        vertices[idx++] = color;
516        vertices[idx++] = u;
517        vertices[idx++] = v2;
518        vertices[idx++] = tweak;
519        vertices[idx++] = ti;
520
521        vertices[idx++] = x3;
522        vertices[idx++] = y3;
523        vertices[idx++] = color;
524        vertices[idx++] = u2;
525        vertices[idx++] = v2;
526        vertices[idx++] = tweak;
527        vertices[idx++] = ti;
528
529        vertices[idx++] = x4;
530        vertices[idx++] = y4;
531        vertices[idx++] = color;
532        vertices[idx++] = u2;
533        vertices[idx++] = v;
534        vertices[idx++] = tweak;
535        vertices[idx++] = ti;
536    }
537
538    @Override
539    public void draw(Texture texture, float x, float y, float width, float height, int srcX, int srcY, int srcWidth,
540                     int srcHeight, boolean flipX, boolean flipY) {
541
542        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("TextureArrayColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
543
544        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
545
546        flushIfFull();
547
548        final float ti = activateTexture(texture);
549
550        float u = srcX * invTexWidth;
551        float v = (srcY + srcHeight) * invTexHeight;
552        float u2 = (srcX + srcWidth) * invTexWidth;
553        float v2 = srcY * invTexHeight;
554        final float fx2 = x + width;
555        final float fy2 = y + height;
556
557        if (flipX) {
558            float tmp = u;
559            u = u2;
560            u2 = tmp;
561        }
562
563        if (flipY) {
564            float tmp = v;
565            v = v2;
566            v2 = tmp;
567        }
568
569        final float color = this.color, tweak = this.tweak;
570
571        vertices[idx++] = x;
572        vertices[idx++] = y;
573        vertices[idx++] = color;
574        vertices[idx++] = u;
575        vertices[idx++] = v;
576        vertices[idx++] = tweak;
577        vertices[idx++] = ti;
578
579        vertices[idx++] = x;
580        vertices[idx++] = fy2;
581        vertices[idx++] = color;
582        vertices[idx++] = u;
583        vertices[idx++] = v2;
584        vertices[idx++] = tweak;
585        vertices[idx++] = ti;
586
587        vertices[idx++] = fx2;
588        vertices[idx++] = fy2;
589        vertices[idx++] = color;
590        vertices[idx++] = u2;
591        vertices[idx++] = v2;
592        vertices[idx++] = tweak;
593        vertices[idx++] = ti;
594
595        vertices[idx++] = fx2;
596        vertices[idx++] = y;
597        vertices[idx++] = color;
598        vertices[idx++] = u2;
599        vertices[idx++] = v;
600        vertices[idx++] = tweak;
601        vertices[idx++] = ti;
602    }
603
604    @Override
605    public void draw(Texture texture, float x, float y, int srcX, int srcY, int srcWidth, int srcHeight) {
606        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("TextureArrayColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
607
608        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
609
610        flushIfFull();
611
612        final float ti = activateTexture(texture);
613
614        final float u = srcX * invTexWidth;
615        final float v = (srcY + srcHeight) * invTexHeight;
616        final float u2 = (srcX + srcWidth) * invTexWidth;
617        final float v2 = srcY * invTexHeight;
618        final float fx2 = x + srcWidth;
619        final float fy2 = y + srcHeight;
620
621        final float color = this.color, tweak = this.tweak;
622
623        vertices[idx++] = x;
624        vertices[idx++] = y;
625        vertices[idx++] = color;
626        vertices[idx++] = u;
627        vertices[idx++] = v;
628        vertices[idx++] = tweak;
629        vertices[idx++] = ti;
630
631        vertices[idx++] = x;
632        vertices[idx++] = fy2;
633        vertices[idx++] = color;
634        vertices[idx++] = u;
635        vertices[idx++] = v2;
636        vertices[idx++] = tweak;
637        vertices[idx++] = ti;
638
639        vertices[idx++] = fx2;
640        vertices[idx++] = fy2;
641        vertices[idx++] = color;
642        vertices[idx++] = u2;
643        vertices[idx++] = v2;
644        vertices[idx++] = tweak;
645        vertices[idx++] = ti;
646
647        vertices[idx++] = fx2;
648        vertices[idx++] = y;
649        vertices[idx++] = color;
650        vertices[idx++] = u2;
651        vertices[idx++] = v;
652        vertices[idx++] = tweak;
653        vertices[idx++] = ti;
654    }

656    @Override
657    public void draw(Texture texture, float x, float y, float width, float height, float u, float v, float u2, float v2) {
658        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("TextureArrayColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");

663
664        final float ti = activateTexture(texture);
665

670

675        vertices[idx++] = v;

704    @Override

707    }

709    @Override
710    public void draw(Texture texture, float x, float y, float width, float height) {
711
712        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("TextureArrayColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
713
714        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
715
716        flushIfFull();
717
718        final float ti = activateTexture(texture);
719
720        final float fx2 = x + width;
721        final float fy2 = y + height;
722        final float u = 0;
723        final float v = 1;
724        final float u2 = 1;
725        final float v2 = 0;
726
727        final float color = this.color, tweak = this.tweak;
728
729        vertices[idx++] = x;
730        vertices[idx++] = y;
731        vertices[idx++] = color;
732        vertices[idx++] = u;
733        vertices[idx++] = v;
734        vertices[idx++] = tweak;
735        vertices[idx++] = ti;
736
737        vertices[idx++] = x;
738        vertices[idx++] = fy2;
739        vertices[idx++] = color;
740        vertices[idx++] = u;
741        vertices[idx++] = v2;
742        vertices[idx++] = tweak;
743        vertices[idx++] = ti;
744
745        vertices[idx++] = fx2;
746        vertices[idx++] = fy2;
747        vertices[idx++] = color;
748        vertices[idx++] = u2;
749        vertices[idx++] = v2;
750        vertices[idx++] = tweak;
751        vertices[idx++] = ti;
752
753        vertices[idx++] = fx2;
754        vertices[idx++] = y;
755        vertices[idx++] = color;
756        vertices[idx++] = u2;
757        vertices[idx++] = v;
758        vertices[idx++] = tweak;
759        vertices[idx++] = ti;
760    }
761
762    @Override
763    public void draw(Texture texture, float[] spriteVertices, int offset, int count) {
764        if (!drawing)
765            throw new IllegalStateException("TextureArrayColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
766
767        count = (count / 5) * 7;
768        int verticesLength = vertices.length;
769        int remainingVertices = verticesLength;
770
771        flushIfFull();
772
773        // Assigns a texture unit to this texture, flushing if none is available
774        final float ti = activateTexture(texture);
775
776        int copyCount = Math.min(remainingVertices, count);
777        final float tweak = this.tweak;
778
779        ////old way, breaks when libGDX code expects SPRITE_SIZE to be 20
780        //System.arraycopy(spriteVertices, offset, vertices, idx, copyCount);
781        ////new way, thanks mgsx
782        for (int s = offset, v = idx, i = 0; i < copyCount; i += 7) {
783            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
784            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
785            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
786            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
787            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
788            vertices[v++] = tweak;
789            vertices[v++] = ti;
790        }
791        idx += copyCount;
792        count -= copyCount;
793        while (count > 0) {
794            offset += (copyCount / 7) * 5;
795            flush();
796            copyCount = Math.min(verticesLength, count);
797            ////old way, breaks when libGDX code expects SPRITE_SIZE to be 20
798            //System.arraycopy(spriteVertices, offset, vertices, 0, copyCount);
799            ////new way, thanks mgsx
800            for (int s = offset, v = 0, i = 0; i < copyCount; i += 7) {
801                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
802                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
803                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
804                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
805                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
806                vertices[v++] = tweak;
807                vertices[v++] = ti;
808            }
809            idx += copyCount;
810            count -= copyCount;
811        }
812    }
813
814    /**
815     * Meant for code that uses ColorfulBatch specifically and can set an extra float (for the color tweak) per vertex,
816     * this is just like {@link #draw(Texture, float[], int, int)} when used in other Batch implementations, but expects
817     * {@code spriteVertices} to have a length that is a multiple of 24 instead of 20.
818     *
819     * @param texture        the Texture being drawn from; usually an atlas or some parent Texture with lots of TextureRegions
820     * @param spriteVertices vertices formatted as this class uses them; length should be a multiple of 24
821     * @param offset         where to start drawing vertices from {@code spriteVertices}
822     * @param count          how many vertices to draw from {@code spriteVertices} (24 vertices is one sprite)
823     */
824    public void drawExactly(Texture texture, float[] spriteVertices, int offset, int count) {
825        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
826
827        count = (count / 6) * 7;
828        int verticesLength = vertices.length;
829        int remainingVertices = verticesLength;
830
831        flushIfFull();
832
833        // Assigns a texture unit to this texture, flushing if none is available
834        final float ti = activateTexture(texture);
835
836        int copyCount = Math.min(remainingVertices, count);
837
838        for (int s = offset, v = idx, i = 0; i < copyCount; i += 7) {
839            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
840            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
841            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
842            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
843            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
844            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
845            vertices[v++] = ti;
846        }
847        idx += copyCount;
848        count -= copyCount;
849        while (count > 0) {
850            offset += (copyCount / 7) * 6;
851            flush();
852            copyCount = Math.min(verticesLength, count);
853
854            for (int s = offset, v = 0, i = 0; i < copyCount; i += 7) {
855                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
856                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
857                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
858                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
859                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
860                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
861                vertices[v++] = ti;
862            }
863            idx += copyCount;
864            count -= copyCount;
865        }
866    }
867
868
869    @Override
870    public void draw(TextureRegion region, float x, float y) {
871        draw(region, x, y, region.getRegionWidth(), region.getRegionHeight());
872    }
873
874    @Override
875    public void draw(TextureRegion region, float x, float y, float width, float height) {
876        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("TextureArrayColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
877
878        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
879
880        flushIfFull();
881
882        final float ti = activateTexture(region.getTexture());
883
884        final float fx2 = x + width;
885        final float fy2 = y + height;
886        final float u = region.getU();
887        final float v = region.getV2();
888        final float u2 = region.getU2();
889        final float v2 = region.getV();
890
891        final float color = this.color, tweak = this.tweak;
892
893        vertices[idx++] = x;
894        vertices[idx++] = y;
895        vertices[idx++] = color;
896        vertices[idx++] = u;
897        vertices[idx++] = v;
898        vertices[idx++] = tweak;
899        vertices[idx++] = ti;
900
901        vertices[idx++] = x;
902        vertices[idx++] = fy2;
903        vertices[idx++] = color;
904        vertices[idx++] = u;
905        vertices[idx++] = v2;
906        vertices[idx++] = tweak;
907        vertices[idx++] = ti;
908
909        vertices[idx++] = fx2;
910        vertices[idx++] = fy2;
911        vertices[idx++] = color;
912        vertices[idx++] = u2;
913        vertices[idx++] = v2;
914        vertices[idx++] = tweak;
915        vertices[idx++] = ti;
916
917        vertices[idx++] = fx2;
918        vertices[idx++] = y;
919        vertices[idx++] = color;
920        vertices[idx++] = u2;
921        vertices[idx++] = v;
922        vertices[idx++] = tweak;
923        vertices[idx++] = ti;
924    }
925
926    @Override
927    public void draw(TextureRegion region, float x, float y, float originX, float originY, float width, float height,
928                     float scaleX, float scaleY, float rotation) {
929
930        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("TextureArrayColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
931
932        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
933
934        flushIfFull();
935
936        final float ti = activateTexture(region.getTexture());
937
938        // bottom left and top right corner points relative to origin
939        final float worldOriginX = x + originX;
940        final float worldOriginY = y + originY;
941        float fx = -originX;
942        float fy = -originY;
943        float fx2 = width - originX;
944        float fy2 = height - originY;
945
946        // scale
947        if (scaleX != 1 || scaleY != 1) {
948            fx *= scaleX;
949            fy *= scaleY;
950            fx2 *= scaleX;
951            fy2 *= scaleY;
952        }
953
954        // construct corner points, start from top left and go counter clockwise
955        final float p1x = fx;
956        final float p1y = fy;
957        final float p2x = fx;
958        final float p2y = fy2;
959        final float p3x = fx2;
960        final float p3y = fy2;
961        final float p4x = fx2;
962        final float p4y = fy;
963
964        float x1;
965        float y1;
966        float x2;
967        float y2;
968        float x3;
969        float y3;
970        float x4;
971        float y4;
972
973        // rotate
974        if (rotation != 0) {
975            final float cos = MathUtils.cosDeg(rotation);
976            final float sin = MathUtils.sinDeg(rotation);
977
978            x1 = cos * p1x - sin * p1y;
979            y1 = sin * p1x + cos * p1y;
980
981            x2 = cos * p2x - sin * p2y;
982            y2 = sin * p2x + cos * p2y;
983
984            x3 = cos * p3x - sin * p3y;
985            y3 = sin * p3x + cos * p3y;
986
987            x4 = x1 + (x3 - x2);
988            y4 = y3 - (y2 - y1);
989        } else {
990            x1 = p1x;
991            y1 = p1y;
992
993            x2 = p2x;
994            y2 = p2y;
995
996            x3 = p3x;
997            y3 = p3y;
998
999            x4 = p4x;
1000            y4 = p4y;
1001        }
1002
1003        x1 += worldOriginX;
1004        y1 += worldOriginY;
1005        x2 += worldOriginX;
1006        y2 += worldOriginY;
1007        x3 += worldOriginX;
1008        y3 += worldOriginY;
1009        x4 += worldOriginX;
1010        y4 += worldOriginY;
1011
1012        final float u = region.getU();
1013        final float v = region.getV2();
1014        final float u2 = region.getU2();
1015        final float v2 = region.getV();
1016
1017        final float color = this.color, tweak = this.tweak;
1018
1019        vertices[idx++] = x1;
1020        vertices[idx++] = y1;
1021        vertices[idx++] = color;
1022        vertices[idx++] = u;
1023        vertices[idx++] = v;
1024        vertices[idx++] = tweak;
1025        vertices[idx++] = ti;
1026
1027        vertices[idx++] = x2;
1028        vertices[idx++] = y2;
1029        vertices[idx++] = color;
1030        vertices[idx++] = u;
1031        vertices[idx++] = v2;
1032        vertices[idx++] = tweak;
1033        vertices[idx++] = ti;
1034
1035        vertices[idx++] = x3;
1036        vertices[idx++] = y3;
1037        vertices[idx++] = color;
1038        vertices[idx++] = u2;
1039        vertices[idx++] = v2;
1040        vertices[idx++] = tweak;
1041        vertices[idx++] = ti;
1042
1043        vertices[idx++] = x4;
1044        vertices[idx++] = y4;
1045        vertices[idx++] = color;
1046        vertices[idx++] = u2;
1047        vertices[idx++] = v;
1048        vertices[idx++] = tweak;
1049        vertices[idx++] = ti;
1050    }
1051
1052    @Override
1053    public void draw(TextureRegion region, float x, float y, float originX, float originY, float width, float height,
1054                     float scaleX, float scaleY, float rotation, boolean clockwise) {
1055
1056        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("TextureArrayColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
1057
1058        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
1059
1060        flushIfFull();
1061
1062        final float ti = activateTexture(region.getTexture());
1063
1064        // bottom left and top right corner points relative to origin
1065        final float worldOriginX = x + originX;
1066        final float worldOriginY = y + originY;
1067        float fx = -originX;
1068        float fy = -originY;
1069        float fx2 = width - originX;
1070        float fy2 = height - originY;
1071
1072        // scale
1073        if (scaleX != 1 || scaleY != 1) {
1074            fx *= scaleX;
1075            fy *= scaleY;
1076            fx2 *= scaleX;
1077            fy2 *= scaleY;
1078        }
1079
1080        // construct corner points, start from top left and go counter clockwise
1081        final float p1x = fx;
1082        final float p1y = fy;
1083        final float p2x = fx;
1084        final float p2y = fy2;
1085        final float p3x = fx2;
1086        final float p3y = fy2;
1087        final float p4x = fx2;
1088        final float p4y = fy;
1089
1090        float x1;
1091        float y1;
1092        float x2;
1093        float y2;
1094        float x3;
1095        float y3;
1096        float x4;
1097        float y4;
1098
1099        // rotate
1100        if (rotation != 0) {
1101            final float cos = MathUtils.cosDeg(rotation);
1102            final float sin = MathUtils.sinDeg(rotation);
1103
1104            x1 = cos * p1x - sin * p1y;
1105            y1 = sin * p1x + cos * p1y;
1106
1107            x2 = cos * p2x - sin * p2y;
1108            y2 = sin * p2x + cos * p2y;
1109
1110            x3 = cos * p3x - sin * p3y;
1111            y3 = sin * p3x + cos * p3y;
1112
1113            x4 = x1 + (x3 - x2);
1114            y4 = y3 - (y2 - y1);
1115        } else {
1116            x1 = p1x;
1117            y1 = p1y;
1118
1119            x2 = p2x;
1120            y2 = p2y;
1121
1122            x3 = p3x;
1123            y3 = p3y;
1124
1125            x4 = p4x;
1126            y4 = p4y;
1127        }
1128
1129        x1 += worldOriginX;
1130        y1 += worldOriginY;
1131        x2 += worldOriginX;
1132        y2 += worldOriginY;
1133        x3 += worldOriginX;
1134        y3 += worldOriginY;
1135        x4 += worldOriginX;
1136        y4 += worldOriginY;
1137
1138        float u1, v1, u2, v2, u3, v3, u4, v4;
1139        if (clockwise) {
1140            u1 = region.getU2();
1141            v1 = region.getV2();
1142            u2 = region.getU();
1143            v2 = region.getV2();
1144            u3 = region.getU();
1145            v3 = region.getV();
1146            u4 = region.getU2();
1147            v4 = region.getV();
1148        } else {
1149            u1 = region.getU();
1150            v1 = region.getV();
1151            u2 = region.getU2();
1152            v2 = region.getV();
1153            u3 = region.getU2();
1154            v3 = region.getV2();
1155            u4 = region.getU();
1156            v4 = region.getV2();
1157        }
1158
1159        final float color = this.color, tweak = this.tweak;
1160
1161        vertices[idx++] = x1;
1162        vertices[idx++] = y1;
1163        vertices[idx++] = color;
1164        vertices[idx++] = u1;
1165        vertices[idx++] = v1;
1166        vertices[idx++] = tweak;
1167        vertices[idx++] = ti;
1168
1169        vertices[idx++] = x2;
1170        vertices[idx++] = y2;
1171        vertices[idx++] = color;
1172        vertices[idx++] = u2;
1173        vertices[idx++] = v2;
1174        vertices[idx++] = tweak;
1175        vertices[idx++] = ti;
1176
1177        vertices[idx++] = x3;
1178        vertices[idx++] = y3;
1179        vertices[idx++] = color;
1180        vertices[idx++] = u3;
1181        vertices[idx++] = v3;
1182        vertices[idx++] = tweak;
1183        vertices[idx++] = ti;
1184
1185        vertices[idx++] = x4;
1186        vertices[idx++] = y4;
1187        vertices[idx++] = color;
1188        vertices[idx++] = u4;
1189        vertices[idx++] = v4;
1190        vertices[idx++] = tweak;
1191        vertices[idx++] = ti;
1192    }
1193
1194    @Override
1195    public void draw(TextureRegion region, float width, float height, Affine2 transform) {
1196        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("TextureArrayColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
1197
1198        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
1199
1200        flushIfFull();
1201
1202        final float ti = activateTexture(region.getTexture());
1203
1204        // construct corner points
1205        float x1 = transform.m02;
1206        float y1 = transform.m12;
1207        float x2 = transform.m01 * height + transform.m02;
1208        float y2 = transform.m11 * height + transform.m12;
1209        float x3 = transform.m00 * width + transform.m01 * height + transform.m02;
1210        float y3 = transform.m10 * width + transform.m11 * height + transform.m12;
1211        float x4 = transform.m00 * width + transform.m02;
1212        float y4 = transform.m10 * width + transform.m12;
1213
1214        float u = region.getU();
1215        float v = region.getV2();
1216        float u2 = region.getU2();
1217        float v2 = region.getV();
1218
1219        final float color = this.color, tweak = this.tweak;
1220
1221        vertices[idx++] = x1;
1222        vertices[idx++] = y1;
1223        vertices[idx++] = color;
1224        vertices[idx++] = u;
1225        vertices[idx++] = v;
1226        vertices[idx++] = tweak;
1227        vertices[idx++] = ti;
1228
1229        vertices[idx++] = x2;
1230        vertices[idx++] = y2;
1231        vertices[idx++] = color;
1232        vertices[idx++] = u;
1233        vertices[idx++] = v2;
1234        vertices[idx++] = tweak;
1235        vertices[idx++] = ti;
1236
1237        vertices[idx++] = x3;
1238        vertices[idx++] = y3;
1239        vertices[idx++] = color;
1240        vertices[idx++] = u2;
1241        vertices[idx++] = v2;
1242        vertices[idx++] = tweak;
1243        vertices[idx++] = ti;
1244
1245        vertices[idx++] = x4;
1246        vertices[idx++] = y4;
1247        vertices[idx++] = color;
1248        vertices[idx++] = u2;
1249        vertices[idx++] = v;
1250        vertices[idx++] = tweak;
1251        vertices[idx++] = ti;
1252    }
1253
1254    /**
1255     * Flushes if the vertices array cannot hold an additional sprite ((spriteVertexSize + 1) * 4 vertices) anymore.
1256     */
1257    protected void flushIfFull() {
1258        // original Sprite attribute size plus two extra floats per sprite vertex
1259        if (vertices.length - idx < spriteFloatSize) {
1260            flush();
1261        }
1262    }
1263
1264    @Override
1265    public void flush() {
1266        if (idx == 0) return;
1267
1268        renderCalls++;
1269        totalRenderCalls++;
1270
1271        int spritesInBatch = idx / spriteFloatSize;
1272        if (spritesInBatch > maxSpritesInBatch) maxSpritesInBatch = spritesInBatch;
1273        int count = spritesInBatch * 6;
1274
1275        // Bind the textures
1276        for (int i = 0; i < currentTextureLFUSize; i++) {
1277            usedTextures[i].bind(i);
1278        }
1279
1280        // Set TEXTURE0 as active again before drawing.
1281        Gdx.gl.glActiveTexture(GL20.GL_TEXTURE0);
1282
1283        Mesh mesh = this.mesh;
1284
1285        mesh.setVertices(vertices, 0, idx);
1286
1287        Buffer indices = (Buffer) mesh.getIndicesBuffer(true);
1288        indices.position(0);
1289        indices.limit(count);
1290
1291        if (blendingDisabled) {
1292            Gdx.gl.glDisable(GL20.GL_BLEND);
1293        } else {
1294            Gdx.gl.glEnable(GL20.GL_BLEND);
1295            if (blendSrcFunc != -1)
1296                Gdx.gl.glBlendFuncSeparate(blendSrcFunc, blendDstFunc, blendSrcFuncAlpha, blendDstFuncAlpha);
1297        }
1298
1299        if (customShader != null) {
1300            mesh.render(customShader, GL20.GL_TRIANGLES, 0, count);
1301        } else {
1302            mesh.render(shader, GL20.GL_TRIANGLES, 0, count);
1303        }
1304
1305        idx = 0;
1306    }
1307
1308    /**
1309     * Assigns Texture units and manages the LFU cache.
1310     *
1311     * @param texture The texture that shall be loaded into the cache, if it is not already loaded.
1312     * @return The texture slot that has been allocated to the selected texture
1313     */
1314    protected int activateTexture(Texture texture) {
1315        invTexWidth = 1.0f / texture.getWidth();
1316        invTexHeight = 1.0f / texture.getHeight();
1317
1318        // This is our identifier for the textures
1319        final int textureHandle = texture.getTextureObjectHandle();
1320
1321        // First try to see if the texture is already cached
1322        for (int i = 0; i < currentTextureLFUSize; i++) {
1323            // getTextureObjectHandle() just returns an int,
1324            // it's fine to call this method instead of caching the value.
1325            if (textureHandle == usedTextures[i].getTextureObjectHandle()) {
1326                // Increase the access counter.
1327                usedTexturesLFU[i]++;
1328                return i;
1329            }
1330        }
1331
1332        // If a free texture unit is available we just use it
1333        // If not we have to flush and then throw out the least accessed one.
1334        if (currentTextureLFUSize < maxTextureUnits) {
1335            // Put the texture into the next free slot
1336            usedTextures[currentTextureLFUSize] = texture;
1337            // Increase the access counter.
1338            usedTexturesLFU[currentTextureLFUSize]++;
1339            return currentTextureLFUSize++;
1340        }
1341
1342        // We have to flush if there is something in the pipeline already,
1343        // otherwise the texture index of previously rendered sprites gets invalidated
1344        if (idx > 0) {
1345            flush();
1346        }
1347
1348        int slot = 0;
1349        int slotVal = usedTexturesLFU[0];
1350
1351        int max = 0;
1352        int average = 0;
1353
1354        // We search for the best candidate for a swap (least accessed) and collect some data
1355        for (int i = 0; i < maxTextureUnits; i++) {
1356            final int val = usedTexturesLFU[i];
1357            max = Math.max(val, max);
1358            average += val;
1359            if (val <= slotVal) {
1360                slot = i;
1361                slotVal = val;
1362            }
1363        }
1364
1365        // The LFU weights will be normalized to the range 0...100
1366        final int normalizeRange = 100;
1367
1368        for (int i = 0; i < maxTextureUnits; i++) {
1369            usedTexturesLFU[i] = usedTexturesLFU[i] * normalizeRange / max;
1370        }
1371
1372        average = (average * normalizeRange) / (max * maxTextureUnits);
1373
1374        // Give the new texture a fair (average) chance of staying.
1375        usedTexturesLFU[slot] = average;
1376
1377        usedTextures[slot] = texture;
1378
1379        // For statistics
1380        currentTextureLFUSwaps++;
1381
1382        return slot;
1383    }
1384
1385    /**
1386     * @return The number of texture swaps the LFU cache performed since calling {@link #begin()}.
1387     */
1388    public int getTextureLFUSwaps() {
1389        return currentTextureLFUSwaps;
1390    }
1391
1392    /**
1393     * @return The current number of textures in the LFU cache. Gets reset when calling {@link #begin()}.
1394     */
1395    public int getTextureLFUSize() {
1396        return currentTextureLFUSize;
1397    }
1398
1399    /**
1400     * @return The maximum number of textures that the LFU cache can hold. This limit is imposed by the driver.
1401     * @see #getMaxTextureUnits()
1402     */
1403    public int getTextureLFUCapacity() {
1404        return getMaxTextureUnits();
1405    }
1406
1407    @Override
1408    public void disableBlending() {
1409        if (blendingDisabled) return;
1410
1411        flush();
1412
1413        blendingDisabled = true;
1414    }
1415
1416    @Override
1417    public void enableBlending() {
1418        if (!blendingDisabled) return;
1419
1420        flush();
1421
1422        blendingDisabled = false;
1423    }
1424
1425    @Override
1426    public void setBlendFunction(int srcFunc, int dstFunc) {
1427        setBlendFunctionSeparate(srcFunc, dstFunc, srcFunc, dstFunc);
1428    }
1429
1430    @Override
1431    public void setBlendFunctionSeparate(int srcFuncColor, int dstFuncColor, int srcFuncAlpha, int dstFuncAlpha) {
1432        if (blendSrcFunc == srcFuncColor && blendDstFunc == dstFuncColor && blendSrcFuncAlpha == srcFuncAlpha
1433                && blendDstFuncAlpha == dstFuncAlpha) {
1434            return;
1435        }
1436
1437        flush();
1438
1439        blendSrcFunc = srcFuncColor;
1440        blendDstFunc = dstFuncColor;
1441        blendSrcFuncAlpha = srcFuncAlpha;
1442        blendDstFuncAlpha = dstFuncAlpha;
1443    }
1444
1445    @Override
1446    public void setProjectionMatrix(Matrix4 projection) {
1447        if (drawing) flush();
1448
1449        projectionMatrix.set(projection);
1450
1451        if (drawing) setupMatrices();
1452    }
1453
1454    @Override
1455    public void setTransformMatrix(Matrix4 transform) {
1456        if (drawing) flush();
1457
1458        transformMatrix.set(transform);
1459
1460        if (drawing) setupMatrices();
1461    }
1462
1463    public void setupMatrices() {
1464        combinedMatrix.set(projectionMatrix).mul(transformMatrix);
1465        if (customShader != null) {
1466            customShader.setUniformMatrix("u_projTrans", combinedMatrix);
1467            Gdx.gl20.glUniform1iv(customShader.fetchUniformLocation("u_textures", true), maxTextureUnits, textureUnitIndicesBuffer);
1468        } else {
1469            shader.setUniformMatrix("u_projTrans", combinedMatrix);
1470            Gdx.gl20.glUniform1iv(shader.fetchUniformLocation("u_textures", true), maxTextureUnits, textureUnitIndicesBuffer);
1471        }
1472    }
1473
1474    /**
1475     * Queries the number of supported textures in a texture array by trying to create the default shader.<br>
1476     * The first call of this method is very expensive, after that it simply returns a cached value.
1477     *
1478     * @return the number of supported textures in a texture array or zero if this feature is unsupported on this device.
1479     * @see #setShader(ShaderProgram shader)
1480     */
1481    public static int getMaxTextureUnits() {
1482        if (maxTextureUnits == -1) {
1483            // Query the number of available texture units and decide on a safe number of texture units to use
1484            IntBuffer texUnitsQueryBuffer = BufferUtils.newIntBuffer(32);
1485
1486            Gdx.gl.glGetIntegerv(GL20.GL_MAX_TEXTURE_IMAGE_UNITS, texUnitsQueryBuffer);
1487
1488            int maxTextureUnitsLocal = texUnitsQueryBuffer.get();
1489
1490            // Some OpenGL drivers (I'm looking at you, Intel!) do not report the right values,
1491            // so we take caution and test it first, reducing the number of slots if needed.
1492            // Will try to find the maximum amount of texture units supported.
1493            while (maxTextureUnitsLocal > 0) {
1494                try {
1495                    ShaderProgram tempProg = createDefaultShader(maxTextureUnitsLocal);
1496                    tempProg.dispose();
1497                    break;
1498                } catch (Exception e) {
1499                    maxTextureUnitsLocal /= 2;
1500                    shaderErrorLog = e.getMessage();
1501                }
1502            }
1503            maxTextureUnits = maxTextureUnitsLocal;
1504        }
1505        return maxTextureUnits;
1506    }
1507
1508    /**
1509     * Sets the shader to be used in a GLES 2.0 environment. Vertex position attribute is called "a_position", the texture
1510     * coordinates attribute is called "a_texCoord0", the color attribute is called "a_color", texture unit index is called
1511     * "a_texture_index", this needs to be converted to int with int(...) in the fragment shader. See
1512     * {@link ShaderProgram#POSITION_ATTRIBUTE}, {@link ShaderProgram#COLOR_ATTRIBUTE} and {@link ShaderProgram#TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE}
1513     * which gets "0" appended to indicate the use of the first texture unit. The combined transform and projection matrix is
1514     * uploaded via a mat4 uniform called "u_projTrans". The texture sampler array is passed via a uniform called "u_textures", see
1515     * {@link TextureArrayColorfulBatch#createDefaultShader(int)} for reference.
1516     * <p>
1517     * Call this method with a null argument to use the default shader.
1518     * <p>
1519     * This method will flush the batch before setting the new shader, you can call it in between {@link #begin()} and
1520     * {@link #end()}.
1521     *
1522     * @param shader the {@link ShaderProgram} or null to use the default shader.
1523     * @see #createDefaultShader(int)
1524     * @see #getMaxTextureUnits()
1525     */
1526    @Override
1527    public void setShader(ShaderProgram shader) {
1528        if (drawing) {
1529            flush();
1530
1531            if (customShader != null) {
1532                customShader.end();
1533            } else {
1534                this.shader.end();
1535            }
1536        }
1537
1538        customShader = shader;
1539
1540        if (drawing) {
1541            if (customShader != null) {
1542                customShader.begin();
1543            } else {
1544                this.shader.begin();
1545            }
1546
1547            setupMatrices();
1548        }
1549    }
1550
1551    @Override
1552    public ShaderProgram getShader() {
1553        if (customShader != null) return customShader;
1554        return shader;
1555    }
1556}
